gui.controller

Class MessageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.controller.MessageController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AckListener, DataListener

    public class MessageController
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataListener, AckListener
    Since:
    8-4-15 Controls the GUI. Implements network.DataListener and network.AckListener
    Author:
    Tistan de Boer

    • Field Detail

      • OWN_NAME

        private static final java.lang.String OWN_NAME
        The name of the user himself. In this case 'Ikzelf', which stands for 'I' in Dutch.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • chatModel

        private final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,javax.swing.DefaultListModel<ChatMessage>> chatModel
        The Model that is used to store all chats (in HashMap. DefaultListModel is used because it can be used to easily populate a JList.

      • clientModel

        private final javax.swing.DefaultListModel<Client> clientModel
        The Model that is used to store all clients. DefaultListModel is used because it can be used to easily populate a JList.

      • processMessage

        private final javax.swing.DefaultListModel<ProcessMessage> processMessage
        The Model that is used to store all files that are transferred Unused since ProcessMessage is extending ChatMessage, it can be stored in chatModel.

        The amount of files sent (used to determine the unique id)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageController

        public MessageController(NetworkManager networkManager)
        Creates a new GUI that is linked to field gui.

        Start a new MessageController, with a fileReceiver (a class that handles incoming data-packets), fileAcker (a class that handles incoming ACK's of sent data-packets), a Gui, a networkManager. It also adds an AckListener and a DataListener to the FileReceiver.

        Parameters:
        networkManager - The networkmanager that can be called.

    • Method Detail

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage()
        Sends a message to recipient currentView with message messageField.getText(). Sends the message to it's own listener and to the NetworkLayer.

      • onAck

        public void onAck(Packet packet)
        Send the ACK to an FileReceiver that has no capability of forming files.
        Specified by:
        onAck in interface AckListener
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet that was ACKed.

      • onReceive

        public void onReceive(Packet packet)
        Receive a message and determine what to do. An packet with datatype Protocol.DataType.TEXT

        If the packet has DataType Protocol.DataType.TEXT, a new chat message will be added to the entry of chatModel that has the same user assigned as the clientModel. If a packet has DataType Protocol.DataType.PING, the 'last seen' of a user will be updated and his name will be updated. If the packet has DataType Packet.DataType.FILE, the packet will be sent to a FileReceiver. This will be done in a Thread, so that the GUI can continue.

        Specified by:
        onReceive in interface DataListener
        Parameters:
        packet - The message the sender has got to tell.

      • sendFile

        public void sendFile(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Handles the file control. Splits up an packet and sends it to the NetworkManager as a packet.

        This thread opens a file and splits it to byte-arrays of a certain length. Headers are added to the byte arrays Packets are generated with that byte-arrays and these packets are sent to the networkManager.

        Parameters:
        path - The path of the file that needs to be send.
        See Also:
        Protocol Design
